name: 陳晏笙
objective:
1. Transmission line theory
2. Impedance matching
3. Microwave network analysis
4. Antenna fundamentals
5. Antenna family and their applications
6. Array fundamentals
7. Basic Principle of Smart Antennas
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Smart Antenna Systems
Week 2: Transmission Line Theory: Frequency-Domain Analysis
Week 3: Transmission Line Theory: Smith Chart
Week 4: Transmission Line Theory: Physical Guided Structures
Week 5: Impedance Matching: Matching with Lumped Elements
Week 6: Impedance Matching: Single-Stub and Double-Stub Matching
Week 7: Spring Break
Week 8: Impedance Matching: Broadband Matching Techniques
Week 9: Microwave Network Analysis: Basic Definitions of Single Network Parameters
Week 10: Microwave Network Analysis: Scattering Parameters
Week 11: Midterm
Week 12: Antenna Fundamentals: Antenna Characteristics
Week 13: Antenna Fundamentals: Antenna Parameters
Week 14: Antenna Family and Their Applications
Week 15: Array Fundamentals: Two-Element Arrays and Pattern Synthesis
Week 16: Array Fundamentals:Uniform N-Element Arrays
Week 17: Basic Principle of Smart Antennas
Week 18: Final
materials:
Texts
1.　　Lecture notes available for download from E-Learning

References
1.　　Pozar, Microwave Engineering, 4th ed., Wiley, 2011.

5.　　Simon Saunders and Alejandro Aragón-Zavala, Antennas and Propagation for Wireless Communication Systems, 2nd Edition, McGraw-Hill, 2007.
